article:
This is a detailed 'listing of human spaceflights' from 1971 to 1980, including
the later Apollo moon landings, the US Skylab missions, and the start of the
Soviet Union's Salyut series of space stations.

* Red indicates fatalities. * Green indicates suborbital flights
(including flights that failed to attain intended orbit). * Grey indicates flights to the Moon. {|
class="wikitable" rules=all cellspacing="0" cellpadding="3" align=center
style="border: 1px solid #555555; text-align: center"
|-
! #
! width="23%"|Crew Launch Spacecraft colspan=2|Habitation
! Return Spacecraft width="35%"|Brief Mission Summary
|-style="background: #DDDDDD;"
! 42
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Alan B. Shepard Stuart A.
| Roosa Edgar D. Mitchell 31 January 1971 Apollo 14
|colspan=2 | Moon
| 9 February 1971 Apollo 14 align="left"|Third lunar landing. Shepard
| becomes only Mercury astronaut to walk on moon and hits golf ball on moon's
| surface. -
! 43
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Vladimir Shatalov Aleksei
| Yeliseyev Nikolai Rukavishnikov
|colspan=2 | 23 April 1971 Soyuz 10 |colspan=2 | 25 April 1971 Soyuz 10
| align="left"|Unsuccessful attempt to board Salyut 1 space station. -
| style="background: #FFDDCC;"
! 44
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Georgiy Dobrovolskiy Viktor
| Patsayev Vladislav Volkov 6 June 1971 Soyuz 11
|colspan=2 | Salyut 1
| 29 June 1971 Soyuz 11 align="left"|Successful boarding of Salyut 1 (first
| manned space station). All crew died on re-entry due to air leak. -
| style="background: #DDDDDD;"
! 45
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| David R. Scott Alfred M.
| Worden James B. Irwin 26 July 1971 Apollo 15
|colspan=2 | Moon
|7 August 1971 Apollo 15 align="left"|Fourth lunar landing. First Lunar
|Rover. -style="background: #DDDDDD;"
! 46
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| John W. Young Thomas K.
| Mattingly Charles M. Duke 6 April 1972 Apollo 16
|colspan=2 | Moon
|27 April 1972 Apollo 16 align="left"|Fifth lunar landing. -
|style="background: #DDDDDD;"
! 47
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Eugene A. Cernan Ronald E.
| Evans Harrison H. Schmitt 7 December 1972 Apollo 17
|colspan=2 | Moon
|19 December 1972 Apollo 17 align="left"|Sixth and last lunar landing. -
! 48
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Charles P. Conrad Paul J.
| Weitz Joseph P. Kerwin 25 May 1973 Skylab 2
|colspan=2 | Skylab
| 22 June 1973 Skylab 2 align="left"|First manned mission to Skylab space
| station. Spent almost one month in space. -
! 49
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Alan L. Bean Jack R. Lousma
| Owen K. Garriott 28 July 1973 Skylab 3
|colspan=2 | Skylab
| 25 September 1973 Skylab 3 align="left"|Spent almost two months in space.
| Miscellaneous scientific experiments. -
! 50
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Vasili Lazarev Oleg Makarov
|colspan=2 | 27 September 1973 Soyuz 12 |colspan=2 | 29 September
1973 Soyuz 12
| align="left"|Test flight of new Soyuz design following Soyuz 11 disaster. -
! 51
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Gerald P. Carr William R.
| Pogue Edward G. Gibson 16 November 1973 Skylab 4
|colspan=2 | Skylab
| 8 February 1974 Skylab 4 align="left"|Spent almost three months in space.
| Miscellaneous scientific experiments conducted. -
! 52
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Valentin Lebedev Pyotr Klimuk
|colspan=2 | 18 December 1973 Soyuz 13 |colspan=2 | 26 December
1973 Soyuz 13
| align="left"|Second test of redesigned Soyuz capsule. Astrophysical
| observations. -
! 53

| July 1974 Soyuz 14
|colspan=2 | Salyut 3
| 19 July 1974 Soyuz 14 align="left"|Military mission. Evaluation of
| military applications of human spaceflight. -
! 54

|colspan=2 | 26 August 1974 Soyuz 15 |colspan=2 | 28 August 1974 Soyuz
15
| align="left"|Failed to board Salyut 3 space station. -

| Rukavishnikov
|colspan=2 | 2 December 1974 Soyuz 16 |colspan=2 | 8 December
1974 Soyuz 16
| align="left"|Systems testing in preparation for joint Soviet-US space
| flight. -
! 56

| January 1975 Soyuz 17
|colspan=2 | Salyut 4
| 10 February 1975 Soyuz 17 align="left"|Astronomical observations. -
| style="background: #BBFFBB;"
! 57

|colspan=4 | 5 April 1975 Soyuz 18a
| align="left"|Failed to reach orbit due to malfunction. -
! 58
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Pyotr Klimuk Vitali Sevastyanov
| 24 May 1975 Soyuz 18
|colspan=2 | Salyut 4
| 26 July 1975 Soyuz 18 align="left"|Research into long-term stays in
| space. -
! 59
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Alexei Leonov Valeri Kubasov
| colspan=2 |15 July 1975 Soyuz 19 colspan=2 |21 July 1975 Soyuz 19
| rowspan=2 align="left"|Apollo-Soyuz Test Project (ASTP); first joint
| Soviet–US spaceflight. The two craft dock in space with exchange of
| flags and gifts. Last manned US mission until STS-1 in 1981. -
! 60
| style="padding-left:0.5em" align="left"| Thomas P. Stafford Vance D.
| Brand Donald K. Slayton colspan=2 |15 July 1975 Apollo-Soyuz colspan=2

| align="left"|Failed to board Salyut 5 space station. -

! 76
